basics.name: Tassia Corcoran
basics.label: Candidate for Master of Science in Information Systems | BBA Management Information Systems | Researcher in Artificial Intelligence & Information Literacy
basics.summary: Technology professional with a strong foundation in generative AI, data systems, and enterprise IT strategy. Experienced in developing AI policy, designing training programs, and leading CRM data reconciliation and integration across academic, nonprofit, and defense-related environments. Currently pursuing a Master's in Information Systems at the University of Hawaii with a 4.0 GPA.

education.institution: University of Hawaii at Mānoa, Honolulu, HI
University of Hawaii at Mānoa, Honolulu, HI

work.position: Curriculum Developer – MSIS Program (AI & Cloud Computing)
work.summary: Designing graduate-level curriculum for the Master's in Information Systems program.
highlights: Developing technical modules covering AWS cloud architecture, certification preparation, and applied machine learning concepts
Creating hands-on labs and case studies to train students in cloud-based AI workflows and enterprise integration strategies
Designing curriculum focused on artificial intelligence and enterprise applications

work.summary: Leading AI implementation and data management initiatives.
highlights: Designed and led company-wide training on Artificial Intelligence tools and concepts, creating use cases to evaluate AI-generated outputs
Successfully reconciled and validated over 100,000 records during Maui Strong donation processing
Co-authored and implemented AI policy guidelines to govern responsible AI use across organizational departments
Cleaned, consolidated, and integrated large-scale relational datasets across multiple CRM platforms
Worked with third-party APIs to streamline data flow and support advanced reporting

work.summary: Led lectures on networking and security fundamentals.
highlights: Led lectures on foundational networking concepts, including LAN/WAN architecture, TCP/IP protocols, wireless standards, and network security principles
Guided students through hands-on exercises in configuring and analyzing network components
Graded and evaluated assignments for 50+ upper-level MIS students

work.summary: DoD Pacific Intelligence & Innovation Initiative (P3I) cyber-spectrum operations internship.
highlights: Worked under the Shipyard Infrastructure Optimization Program (SIOP) researching digital twin technologies for Pearl Harbor Navy Shipyard
Led AI implementation seminars, training professionals on practical use cases, policy, and ethical integration
Built a geodatabase that improved the Navy's ability to track hazardous waste, raw materials, and over $10M in equipment
Analyzed 7,000+ data points across 4 reports, identified 38+ unique equipment discrepancies, and visualized misalignments

work.summary: Teaching and guiding students in computer fundamentals and programming concepts.
highlights: Facilitated classes of 45 students on HTML, CSS, UNIX, and Microsoft programs
Designed and delivered hands-on training sessions introducing students to generative AI tools, responsible use, and prompt engineering
Mentored a team of 5 assistants during open lab hours
Successfully supported over 400 students through hands-on troubleshooting and technical support

work.summary: Conducting IRB-approved research on generative AI in education.
highlights: Conducted IRB-approved research on student proficiency, ethics, and perceptions of generative AI through multi-phase studies
Evaluated prompt engineering strategies for content generation and information queries
Applied ACRL standards to evaluate AI tool use in student writing and information literacy development
Co-authored and presented a peer-reviewed paper at an international conference

work.summary: Providing expert consulting services and customized training seminars.
highlights: Delivered customized training seminars on Microsoft programs and computer usage to management employees
Designed and facilitated interactive workshops, enhancing employees' proficiency in key Microsoft tools
Designed transition-oriented curricula tailored to adult learners unfamiliar with office productivity tools

work.summary: Supply chain risk management for SOCPAC contracts.
highlights: Enhanced SCRM processes by utilizing Microsoft Power Automate to streamline file management and schedule critical tasks
Collaborated with onsite teams to gather and analyze logistical data essential for contract fulfillment
Focused on supply chain risk management for SOCPAC contracts within the Export/Logistics division

activities.organization: National Center for Women in Technology
activities.summary: Advancing diversity in tech at UH Mānoa.
highlights: Established the NCWIT chapter at UH Mānoa to advance diversity in tech
Led outreach events promoting technology careers and academic support
Mentored students in tech courses and advised on career pathways
Collaborated with campus leadership and industry partners to drive inclusion in computing fields

awards.title: Dean's List
awards.summary: Recognized for achieving a GPA of 3.5 or higher each semester.

publications.name: Information Literacy: A Foundational Approach to Generative AI Competence
publications.publisher: EdMedia World Conference on Educational Technology
publications.summary: Presented at the EdMedia World Conference on Educational Technology, Barcelona, Spain, May 2025. Co-authored with C. Olsen.
